intro: Fadogia manikensis, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the savannas of West Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats with sufficient sunlight. Fadogia manikensis is also valued for its traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
